description: Three people who were previously unaccounted for in Longwood east have been found safe. More than 115 structures have been destroyed but there are fears that number could grow significantly. It comes as Victoriaâ€™s Premier declared a state of disaster as out of control fires continue to burn across the state. title: State of disaster declared in Victoria as bushfires continue | ABC NEWS
description: Three people declared missing by authorities after a house was destroyed by Victoria's Longwood bushfire have been found safe and well, Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan says.  Emergency-level bushfires continue to rage across the state, prompting the premier to officially announce a state of disaster overnight.  Exact numbers of properties lost are yet to be confirmed, but those impacted are eligible for hardship assistance. title: New video emerges of ICE agent shooting Renee Good | ABC NEWS
description: A new angle has emerged of the moment a woman was shot by an ICE agent in Minneapolis. The video shows 37-year-old Renee Good interacting with the immigration agent shortly before she was killed. Local authorities in Minnesota have raised concerns they're being shut out of federal investigations into the incident. The shooting has sparked protests across the United States amid an ongoing immigration enforcement crackdown. title: SA government officials reject claims of political interference into algal bloom causes | ABC NEWS
description: Senior public servants have faced a committee to reject claims of government interference in scientific research into the cause of SA's algal bloom.  Faith Coleman, who raised those comments in same committee earlier this week, wants a parliamentary inquiry to "investigate to see if they could find a more direct chain of evidence".  Ms Coleman has also indicated to the government that she now intends to resign from two government algal bloom panels. title: Victoria bushfire disaster devastates communities across the state | ABC NEWS
description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has declared a state of disaster as bushfires rage across the state. Firefighters spent the day fighting tough conditions with the most dangerous fires at Longwood and Walwa in the north-east, Ravenswood in central Victoria, multiple fires in the Otways, and near Horsham in the west. At least 130 homes and buildings have been destroyed and more than 300,000 hectares of land burned. Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2026-01-10/state-of-disaster-declared-bushfires-victoria/106215462  00:00 - State of disaster declared as fires rage across Victoria. 01:05 - Longwood fire razes homes with fears of flare-ups. 03:18 - Natimuk residents return to destruction after Grass Flat fire. 05:28 - Bushfire engulfs Harcourt community at ferocious speed. 07:58 - Nicole Asher reports from Seymour. 08:43 - Harrison Tippet reports from Colac. 10:06 - Ashlee Aldridge reports from Wodonga. title: NSW swelters through extreme heatwave with temperatures in the 40s | ABC NEWS
description: NSW has sweltered through extreme heat with the highest temperature recorded close to 45Â°C. The conditions saw total fire bans across the state with firefighters on high alert. title: Suspected copper thieves see North Queensland lose communications ahead of cyclone | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Category two Cyclone Koji is expected to hit the North Queensland coast early Sunday morning. 00:23 The slow moving system has authorities concerned it could cause deadly flash flooding. 00:53 Police are investigating in northern Townsville after a copper wire theft knocked out phone and internet services. 1:38 Locals in Cordelia are still recovering from flooding in 2025, and are expecting to be cut off again. 02:13 Reporter Baz Ruddick joins the program from Townsville, saying the system has already had major impacts on the region in the lead up to it coming ashore. 03:36 Jacqui McLaren takes a look at the charts and outlines what the system could have in store. Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2026-01-10/queensland-tropical-low-expected-to-intensify-into-cyclone-koji/106213662  If you are in the Townsville region and feel unsafe, the local shelters and places of refuge are open, with people encouraged to seek shelter there. title: 'Airport brain' sees troves of luggage left behind by travellers | ABC NEWS
description: As Australians hit the skies for summer holidays, airports prepare for more than just big crowds. They also gear up for a surge in lost and forgotten luggage. Each year, tens of thousands of lost items are found at airports, costing the aviation industry billions. title: Bushfire disaster relief for farmers after loss of crucial fodder | ABC NEWS
description: President of the Victorian Farmers Federation, Brett Hosking, says the state bushfire disaster has had a heavy emotional toll on farmers impacted by property loss. The federation's disaster relief fund will provide farmer-led support, including the distribution of crucial livestock fodder to replace what was burnt up in the blaze. title: Cricket ball caught with one hand, two beers | ABC NEWS
description: While there was plenty of action on the ground at Adelaide Oval when the Strikers won against the Thunder, off the pitch there was an even more impressive catch.   This spectator managed to take a stunning one hander in the Member's area off a six from Nic Maddinson, all while holding two drink cans in the other hand.
